required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Thrombus Aspiration in Heavy Thrombus Burden Acute ST-elevation Myocardial Infarction
clinical_study.official_title: Thrombus Aspiration in Heavy Thrombus Burden Acute ST-elevation Myocardial Infarction: TSUNAMI Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: The Young Investigator Group of Cardiovascular Research

clinical_study.source: The Young Investigator Group of Cardiovascular Research

brief_summary.textblock:
Recent guidelines for the management of ST-elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) recommend against the routine use of thrombus aspiration (TA) during primary percutaneous coronary intervention (PPCI) (Class III indication). Yet, so far, there is limited data regarding its role STEMI patients with heavy thrombus burden (TB).
The aim of this trial is to evaluate the effects of manual TA and PCI in comparison to conventional PCI alone in a real-life clinical trial among heavy TB STEMI patients undergoing PPCI.

detailed_description.textblock:
Recent guidelines for the management of ST-elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) recommend against the routine use of thrombus aspiration (TA) during primary percutaneous coronary intervention (PPCI) (Class III indication). Yet, so far, there is limited data regarding its role in STEMI patients with heavy thrombus burden (TB).
The aim of this trial is to evaluate the effects of manual TA and PCI in comparison to conventional PCI alone in a real-life clinical trial among heavy TB STEMI patients undergoing PPCI.

primary_outcome.description: Successful revascularization assessed by TIMI flow
Successful revascularization assessed by myocardial blush.
Successful revascularization assessed by ST-segment resolution.

primary_outcome.measure: In-hospital Major adverse cerebrovascular and cardiovascular events (MACCE)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of any major adverse cerebrovascular and cardiovascular events which includes: death (either all-cause or cardiac), nonfatal myocardial infarction, stroke and revascularization (with optional additional specification of target vessel or lesion, i.e., if the revascularization occurred at the site of a previously identified diseased coronary vessel or atherosclerotic lesion, respectively)

primary_outcome.measure: Short term Major adverse cerebrovascular and cardiovascular events (MACCE)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of any major adverse cerebrovascular and cardiovascular events which includes: death (either all-cause or cardiac), nonfatal myocardial infarction, stroke and revascularization (with optional additional specification of target vessel or lesion, i.e., if the revascularization occurred at the site of a previously identified diseased coronary vessel or atherosclerotic lesion, respectively) in the period of 6 months after randomization.

secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of any bleeding that may be encountered during the hospital stay after randomization. (Major or Minor)
Incidence of any event of heart failure that may be encountered during the hospital stay after randomization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Short term Hospitalization due to heart failure
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of any event of heart failure that may be encountered during any other re-admission due to a "heart failure" diagnosis up to 6 months after randomization.

arm_group.description: Manual Thrombus aspiration in STEMI patients with Heavy thrombus burden (TIMI 0-1 or TB classification 4-5)
Conventional PCI according to the most recent guidelines in STEMI patients with no heavy thrombus burden (TIMI 0-1 or TB classification 4-5)

intervention.description: Manual thrombus aspiration using one of the FDA approved aspirators will be done.
Standard PCI according to the most recent guidelines

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- STEMI patients with heavy thrombus burden as assessed by TIMI score of 0-1 or thrombus burden classification 4-5
Exclusion Criteria:
- STEMI patients with low thrombus burden (TIMI 2-3 or TB 0-3)
- History of hypersensitivity or allergy to any of the study drugs, as well as known or suspected contraindications to the study drugs.
- Symptomatic hypotension and/or an SBP < 100 mmHg at the time of randomization.
